Ben Jackman
I’m an economist and data scientist in Sydney. I work in Monetary Policy Implementation at the Reserve Bank of Australia. I have a background in economics and data science – you can find more about my experience and education in my CV. I’m interested in macro, finance, central banking, and data science. The public work post highlights some of my publicly available professional work, and others document what else I’ve been tinkering with. You can contact me via email, Twitter, or on the terminal.
This an updated personal website using the new Quarto framework, primarily built via RStudio. Thanks to Marvin Schmitt for the helpful template.

title: Photography
text:
As a wizard and scholar of Middle-earth, I have been studying the magic of the natural world for centuries. Through my self-portraits, I aim to capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through my photography, I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a scholar and adventurer, and inspire others to reflect on their own journeys through the world.

title: Professional Work
text: In 2022 my colleague Ahmet Aziz and I wrote in the RBA Bulletin about the AOFM and RBA’s securities lending, which had grown to very large levels that year. This article discusses the purpose and design of the securities lending facilities, why their usage had grown so much, and a stylised example of the bonds-futures basis trade underlying some of the activity.

title: Professional Work
text:
August 2021 - Use of the TFF

arXiv Preprint | Code
In August 2021 we provided an update in the Statement on Monetary Policy on usage of the Term Funding Facility (more detail see below). This outlined how most of the funding available under the TFF was drawndown, and includes a table of the top 10 biggest borrowers.

title: Professional Work
text:
December 2020 - The Term Funding Facility

arXiv Preprint | Code
In December 2020, some of my colleagues and I put out an article in the RBA Bulletin on the RBA’s Term Funding Facility (TFF). It outlined the purpose and design of the facility, as well as how it had been used to date.
In March 2020, I returned to Australia from full-time study 6 months earlier than expected as the severity of the pandemic became clear. I offered to give my colleagues a hand with their workload, expecting to do some odd jobs, but ended up helping set up the TFF. This became most of my work for two years, and was an enjoyable experience where I learned a lot.
